intro: Pycnostelma lateriflorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pycnostelma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
